items.title: Security vision shows terrifying speed of a new kind of climate-driven fire
items.description: A grassfire tore through Natimuk in minutes, overwhelming warnings and emergency response. Experts say it signals a dangerous new phase of bushfires.

items.title: Lancet rejects Trump's 'politicisation' of paracetamol use in pregnancy
items.description: Just months after US President Donald Trump warned women about taking paracetamol during pregnancy, a new study finds there is no evidence linking the painkiller to autism in children.

items.title: A realignment is underway in the Middle East
items.description: Israel joining with other countries in the Middle East to press Donald Trump not to launch a military strike against a weakened Iran is something that would have seemed incomprehensible even a couple of years ago.

items.title: Iran's young are dying for the freedom they see in black and white photos
items.description: As protests shake Iran, massive crowds rising up against the hard-line mullahs and their supporters have been bolstered by the country's younger generations.

items.title: Renters swapping apartments for boats for inner-city living at $500 a week
items.description: Living at Brisbane’s Kangaroo Point overlooking the river would typically come with a hefty price tag, but some residents have found an alternative.

items.title: Passport rule change disrupts travel plans for thousands of Aussies
items.description: From February 25, dual citizens of the UK and Ireland will be required to enter the UK using a valid British or Irish passport, a change causing major headaches for dual citizens with imminent travel plans.

items.title: Iran's unrest is shaping China's view of power and world order
items.description: Xi Jinping's ambition is to occupy a central position in a reshaped international system, not to lead a permanent grouping of sanctioned or crisis-prone states.

items.title: Rain and cyclone threat in weekend of weather hazards across Australia
items.description: January is the middle of Australia's severe weather season and a multitude of hazards are emerging across the country this weekend.

items.title: 'Relief' as world's biggest electric ferry starts sea trials
items.description: It is a world first — and years in the making — and when the massive electric ferry moved out into open water in Hobart for testing, there was a "big sigh of relief".

items.title: Trump threatens tariffs on countries that oppose US Greenland takeover
items.description: The US president insists America needs to acquire the territory of NATO partner Denmark for national security reasons.

items.title: Midwife banned from working unsupervised handed $1.1m NT government contract
items.description: Darwin midwife Claire Marks, who has been placed under a number of conditions by Australia's medical regulator, will continue to run the Northern Territory government's new private practice midwifery service, it's been confirmed.

items.title: Lance Armstong destroyed his legacy with five monosyllabic answers to Oprah
items.description: Lance Armstrong had successfully doped for years. But when the evidence backed him into a corner he took control of the narrative and confessed live on Oprah's couch, martyring himself to cycling's EPO era.

items.title: 'It played enough on my life': Victim-survivor reveals identity to help others
items.description: Nicholas Taylor told a court last year that he was abused as a student at a Hobart Catholic school in the 1970s and 1980s. One of his alleged abusers was former Test cricket umpire Stephen Randell.

items.title: Sandbank warning after tourist suffers catastrophic injuries at iconic beach
items.description: A young Greek tourist is flooded with donations and support after a tragic accident at Perth's most iconic beach left him with life-changing injuries.

items.title: Smith breaks BBL record and outduels Warner as Pakistan teammate fumes
items.description: Steve Smith smashes 32 runs from a single over after denying Babar Azam the strike, leaving the star Pakistan recruit less than impressed.

items.title: New dictionary aims to 'awaken' language not spoken fluently for 100 years
items.description: After more than a century of silence, the Bunurong language is being brought back to life by elders, linguists and community.

items.title: Tasty one-tray lemon garlic chicken with green beans and potatoes
items.description: This bright and flavourful chicken tray bake take just 15 minutes to prep and bakes in one tray.

items.title: Clean-up continues along Great Ocean Road after disastrous floods
items.description: Emergency services have defended warning times as locals recover from the record-breaking rains and worst floods in the area since the 80s.

items.title: Developer's bid to demolish 140-year-old flour mill walls faces backlash
items.description: As the wrecking ball looms, a community battle is brewing over whether historic flour mill walls need to fall to make way for development.

items.title: 'Living the dream': Growing up with Australia's first skate park
items.description: Australia is home to one of the world's oldest surviving skate parks, which is as much a product of surfing culture as it is a time capsule of skating history.

items.title: The SA premier faced one of his most bruising weeks yet. Will it matter come election time?
items.description: The dramatic cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week spiralled the news cycle out of Premier Peter Malinauskas's control. But will the saga actually mean anything come the March state election?

items.title: How to talk to your children about the allegations against author Craig Silvey
items.description: A prominent parenting expert says serious allegations made against one of Australia’s most renowned authors should spark difficult but important conversations in households across the country.

items.title: Why this Olympian is proud to be a gay role model despite trolling
items.description: Campbell Harrison was homophobically trolled in the lead-up to the Paris Olympics. It strengthened his conviction about the importance of visible queer role models in sport.

items.title: Children in Ukraine risk hypothermia after Russian attacks, aid groups say
items.description: International aid agencies say children across Ukraine risk hypothermia in freezing temperatures as emergency stocks of power generators run low following Russian attacks on energy infrastructure.

items.title: Berrettini fighting illness ahead of Australian Open clash with de Minaur
items.description: Alex de Minaur's first-round opponent, Matteo Berrettini, faces a race against time to be fit for the start of the Australian Open.
